headline: Chris Auffenberg Announces Year-End Sales Event on 2025 Ford Models
summary: Chris Auffenberg is excited to announce the launch of its Year-End Sales Event, offering some of the best incentives of the season on select 2025 Ford models. For a limited time, qualified buyers can enjoy 0% APR for 60 months, $0 down payment, and no payments for up to 90 days on eligible Ford vehicles. This limited-time promotion provides drivers with an excellent opportunity to upgrade to a new Ford with exceptional savings. (Offer excludes taxes, title, and license fees.)

raw.headline: Chris Auffenberg Announces Year-End Sales Event on 2025 Ford Models

This limited-time promotion provides drivers with an excellent opportunity to upgrade to a new Ford with exceptional savings. (Offer excludes taxes, title, and license fees.)

headline: Americans Don’t Want EVs—and They Won’t Buy These Either
summary: One idea from President Donald Trump’s press conference about fuel-efficiency standards that has gained surprising traction is the possibility that ultrasmall cars could come to America.  On Wednesday, Trump gathered auto executives at the White House to announce he is rolling back strict, Biden-era standards that would have required manufacturers to significantly boost the average mileage per gallon for their fleets.  Auto executives feared, correctly, that it would be impossibly to comply, given current technology and consumer tastes.

headline: GM CEO Barra joins Ford in backing controversial White House policy
summary: The U.S. tariffs on imported automotives and automotive parts have cost GM immensely this year. Tariff payments shaved $2.8 billion off General Motors second-quarter adjusted automotive free cash flow, causing a $2.5 billion year-over-year decrease. U.S. market ...

headline: Ford recalls nearly 109,000 U.S. vehicles over liftgate hinge issue
summary: Additional Lincoln MKT recall expands safety checks across older models

headline: How is General Motors Planning to Rebuild Its Profitability?
summary: GM targets an 8-10% North American margin rebound by cutting tariff burdens, stabilizing warranty costs and resizing EV capacity to match demand.
